articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said India fired missiles at three air bases early on Saturday including one close to the capital, Islamabad, but Pakistani air defences intercepted most of them as the neighbours extended their worst fighting in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Pakistan says three air bases targeted by Indian missiles

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukraine and European leaders agreed on Saturday to an unconditional 30-day ceasefire on May 12 with the backing of U.S. President Donald Trump, threatening President Vladimir Putin with new "massive" sanctions if he failed to comply.
articles.title: Europe leaders, in Kyiv, turn up pressure on Russia over ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's vice premier He Lipeng held talks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent early on Saturday in Geneva, China's state-owned news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China-US trade talks begin in Geneva

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Saturday that fighting had been taking place in four regions of Ukraine despite this week's unilateral ceasefire by Moscow, saying its troops had been forced to respond to Ukrainian attacks.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine blame each other as fighting continues despite Moscow's truce

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV took his first trip outside the Vatican on Saturday, heading about an hour's drive east of Rome to the small Italian town of Genazzano to visit a shrine to the Virgin Mary.
articles.title: Pope Leo visits shrine near Rome on first trip outside Vatican as pontiff

articles.author: Alina Smutko, Herbert Villarraga
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has declared a three-day pause in fighting against Ukraine, but for bloodied Ukrainian soldiers limping into a field hospital, their wounds testified that the ceasefire was not being respected.
articles.title: Wounded Ukrainian soldiers ask: What ceasefire?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey is ready to undertake the duty to observe a possible ceasefire in Ukraine, its foreign minister said during a "coalition of the willing" call with Kyiv's partners on Saturday, a Turkish foreign ministry source said.
articles.title: Turkey ready to undertake duty for observing potential ceasefire in Ukraine, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The new German foreign minister, Johann Wadephul, departed for Israel on Saturday for a Middle East trip in which "critical discussions" are expected, he said when leaving Berlin.
articles.title: New German foreign minister travels to Israel for 'critical discussions'

articles.author: Philip Pullella, Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV signalled on Saturday he would continue with the vision and reforms of Pope Francis, telling the world's Catholic cardinals the late pontiff left a "precious legacy" that must carry on.
articles.title: Pope Leo tells cardinals they must continue 'precious legacy' of Pope Francis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Members of Chinese and U.S. delegations left a Geneva lakeside venue late on Saturday afternoon after holding a day of trade talks, according to Reuters reporters at the scene.
articles.title: Chinese and US trade negotiators leave Geneva venue, unclear if trade talks continuing
